audio_caption: The audio clip begins with upbeat electronic music that conveys a cheerful, welcoming atmosphere. This fades out and a male speaker with a clear, newscaster-like voice begins to describe Megan Markle's attire at a wedding, noting the price and style of the black gown, and mentioning the reactions this choice elicited. A quote describes the choice of black as "shocking." The music returns at the end, with the same upbeat electronic style as before.

The audio clip begins with a male speaker noting that someone might have taken style cues from "the other side of the pond", where wearing black to a wedding is more accepted. He explains that model Karlie Kloss wore a black gown to an event related to the groom, and that Roman Abramovich's ex-wife also wore a black dress to the ceremony.

The audio clip features a single male speaker with an informative tone. He initially discusses the high price of Meghan's gown and why her outfit choice was considered "shocking" by British experts, noting that "black seen as being much more taboo" at weddings. He proceeds to quote a stylist, Lucas, who praised the Duchess's on-trend look and her ability to channel popular trends from "couture catwalks." The speaker further details that "black sheer garments" are fashionable for the upcoming season and Meghan is "riding the crest of the trend wave early," adding that her jewelry taps into the "eclectic accessory trend." He concludes that Meghan isn't a "slave to fashion," distilling the catwalk into her own style.

The audio begins with a male speaker discussing the price differences of a gown, noting the higher cost in the US versus the UK due to import duties, and describes its embellishments. The speaker's tone is informative and slightly descriptive. He then mentions Meghan Markle's choice of gown, describing its risky elements and the accessories that accompanied it. A brief musical segment of piano plays at a moderate tempo at the end of the clip.

The audio clip begins with a male speaker suggesting that, "stylist Suzie Hasler, of Styled by Suzie, suggested that Megan may have worn the black dress in order to redirect the spotlight". The speaker continues to explain, in a conversational tone, that this ensured, "all eyes remained on the bride and groom". The speaker ends by saying, "Wearing black is the perfect way for Megan to redirect the spotlight away from her".

The audio clip begins with a female speaker who explains that the color black is appropriate, because she does not want to steal the bride's thunder. She stated that a lot of her clients use black so they can "hide away". She continues that if the Dutchess had worn bright red, she "would have been accused of attention grabbing". As she finishes, calm, reflective music begins playing, while the speaker continues to talk. She said that wearing black is a good choice for "being unassuming" and that black has become an acceptable color for weddings. She adds, "Megan's choice ticks a number of fashion boxes". She notes that the choice of black is in keeping with the close friendship. Then, the music and narration end.

The audio clip features a single male speaker providing a news report. He begins by discussing a controversial baby shower and subsequent criticism of Meghan and Prince Harry's use of private jets.  He later transitions to discuss an outfit reminiscent of the Duchess of Sussex, including a sheer couture dress. The speaker mentions a mid-length black gown worn to the European premiere of the Lion King. Lastly, the Duke and Duchess of Sussex attend the nuptials of a designer friend. The speaker has an informative and serious tone throughout the clip.

The clip starts with a male narrator describing the arrival of "blushing bride Miss Ha" who designed her own wedding dress, followed by Prince Harry and Meghan, who arrived in a golf buggy with Princess Eugenie. The narrator has a formal, reportorial tone. Afterwards, an indistinct sound is heard, but is not discernable as either music, background noise, or otherwise.

The audio begins with a single male speaker describing an event at a "grand property in the west of Roman property" involving "200 guests wearing black tie or gowns". The description includes details about the property, such as a "giant terrace, ballroom, and dining room" that serves "Michelin star quality food".

The audio clip begins with a single male speaker describing Villa Oleandra as one of Italy's "most prestigious wedding venues," emphasizing its high rental cost, "$24,700 per day," excluding additional expenses such as food and flowers. The speaker maintains a neutral and informative tone.

The audio clip begins with a male speaker thanking viewers for watching a video on the "LMT Royal Channel". He encourages them to subscribe and enjoy the new videos. A short, upbeat electronic music interlude plays, followed by more electronic music with a slightly subdued and melancholic tone. The main instrument appears to be keyboard.
